Job Title: Senior Investment Analyst - Fixed Income, Credit and Cash
Category: Corporate Finance & Investment Banking (Banking & Financial Services)
Ad Text:
We’re representing a leading large funds management organisation with a high-performing, collegiate investments team managing diversified portfolios across domestic and global markets.
  
Reporting to a top-tier investment leader, this role sits within the Fixed Income, Credit and Cash team and will focus on analytical oversight, performance monitoring, and investment reporting across global and domestic credit markets.
  
�� The Opportunity
- Analyse and monitor external managers across credit and fixed income mandates
- Provide performance attribution, reporting and market intelligence
- Collaborate with investment operations, performance and risk teams on liquidity, compliance and portfolio analytics
- Gain exposure across sovereign bonds, macro and liquidity management, and asset allocation processes
- Contribute to due diligence, research and modelling supporting investment decisions
  
�� About You
- 5–7 years’ experience across institutional investing, consulting, asset management or credit ratings
- Strong analytical and quantitative aptitude
- Sound knowledge of fixed income and credit markets (sovereign, corporate or hybrid)
- Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management
  
  
Total package: circa $200K, including super, with annual reviews based on performance.
  
This is an opportunity to join a high-calibre investment team known for its analytical rigour, collaborative culture and exposure to sophisticated institutional portfolios.
  
If you’re ready to leverage your credit and fixed income expertise within a large, values-driven investment business — reach out for a confidential discussion.

schenuk.wijesekera@perigongroup.com.au

Category:
Analysis & Reporting (Banking & Financial Services)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Are you an experienced finance leader ready to drive corporate management accounting and performance reporting across Queensland Health? Step into the role of Director, Analysis in Finance Branch and drive expert insights, lead a high-performing team, and champion greater transparency. Benefit from flexible work arrangements, professional growth opportunities, and the chance to make a meaningful impact.

What you'll do

Co-ordinate and complete effective executive reporting, including identifing significant variations and trends across Queensland Health.
Provide high quality advice, information and guidance to Executive Management, HHSs and Divisions, particularly in relation to financial analysis and management.
Proactively identify business improvement opportunities and recommend strategies to realise the benefits.
Ensure that systems are established and maintained to provide budget transparency and forecasting integrity.
Lead and promote a professional and responsive team to meet the information and financial management advice needs of health services.

About you

We are searching for someone with:

Accounting qualifications and membership of a recognised professional accounting body.
Demonstrated ability to provide effective leadership and management at a senior level within a service delivery organisation involving multi-disciplinary programs and diverse work units.
High-level knowledge of financial management legislation relevant to Queensland Health.
Highly developed communication and interpersonal competence, including the capacity to negotiate, resolve conflict and positively influence and motivate others in a significant environment of reform and change.
Well-developed skills, including high level ability in the areas of planning, managing resources, budget preparation and management, project management, objective setting and monitoring, coaching and performance feedback and management.
Proven issue identification, analytical and research skills, problem solving skills and a demonstrated ability to develop innovative, sensitive and practical solutions and provide strategic advice to complex issues.
Understanding of the financial pressures and constraints that impact service delivery and the capacity to recommend courses of action which achieve optimal outcomes within those constraints.

Why work with us?

Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. This includes

Competitive salaries

12.75% superannuation
17.5% leave loading

Employee wellbeing

38 hour full time work week
Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave.

Professional development

Career progression with more than 300 diverse career pathways and career support to take you further!
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.
Grow your skills through hands-on experience and access to internal training opportunities and additional financial and leave benefits for approved external training and development.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion 

At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds.

Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions. 

Ready to apply?

For further information on how to apply please review the attached Role Description.

Applications will remain current for a period of up to 12 months and may be considered for other vacancies which may include an alternative employment basis such as temporary, full time or part time.
